author: Kiri Blakeley For Dailymail.com
title: Man charges onto school bus to attack teen boy
text:
A man who was caught on video assaulting a teen on a school bus for 'messing with' his stepdaughter was arrested.
Karl Vernon Williams can be seen on cell phone video getting on a Lugoff-Elgin High School school bus that stopped in Kershaw County, South Carolina on Tuesday and confronting a boy who is sitting down.
'Are you the one that's been messing with my stepdaughter?' he demands.
Karl Williams can be seen angrily stomping onto the bus and headed toward a sitting teen
He demands to know if he's the teen 'messing with' his stepdaughter, then appears to haul off and whack him in the head
Karl Williams, 36, is charged with assault, and battery third degree, disturbing schools, and interfering with the operation of a school bus
Someone says 'no' and then Williams, 36, hauls off and appears to smack the 16-year-old on the head.
'Get out, get out,' someone says.
The man then walks off the bus and the girl gets off with him.
The sheriff's department released the video, reports WLTX .
Authorities say the 'stepdaughter' he is referring to is his girlfriend's daughter and had earlier gotten into a confrontation with the boy.
When the 16-year-old boy returned home, his mother called police to report that he'd been attacked on the bus.
Williams was arrested the next day. He was released on $2,400 bond and it wasn't known if he had a lawyer.
The overprotective father-figure is charged with assault and battery third degree, disturbing schools, and interfering with the operation of a school bus.
'Williams decided to take the matter into his own hands and when the school bus stopped to drop off the female, he boarded the bus, assaulted the male victim and left,' said Kershaw County Sheriff Jim Matthews.
